#Content
.sections_group
Meet The Band
Meet the most talented and dedicated musicians the Treasure Coast has to offer led by renowned conductor Dr. John K. Southall.
The musicians of the Port St. Lucie Community Band are the face of our organization.
They are your neighbors, the music school teachers in our school and a group of talented musicians with a lot of love and dedication. Get to know them here.

mfn_hook_content_before
mfn_hook_content_before
#Content
.sections_group
Need Answers?
Need a band for your event? Want to join our band?
Please feel free to contact us to obtain additional information, if you would like to join the band, or to inquire about arranging a performance.
(860) 933-2960
Rehearsals
Weekly rehearsals take place at the Indian River State College Rehearsal Hall (3209 Virginia Avenue, Fort Pierce, Florida) on Wednesdays, 6:30 to 8:30 p.m.
Band Members Notifications
Get push notifications on your phone. Sign up for the Text Remind program for last minute band updates. On your iPhone or Android phone,
open your web browser and go to:
http://rmd.at/pslcb
Follow the instructions to sign up. You’ll be prompted to download the mobile app. If you don’t have a smartphone, get text notifications by texting the message @pslcb to the number 81010.
We are here to answer any questions you may have.
Please enable JavaScript in your browser to complete this form.

Listen To The Port St. Lucie Community Band
Home
Listen To The Port St. Lucie Community Band
mfn_hook_content_before
mfn_hook_content_before
#Content
.sections_group
Bringing The Gift Of Live Music To The Treasure Coast
Enjoy Highlights From Our Concerts.
Play
Stop
Next»
«Prev
HIDE PLAYLIST
X
If you are interested in making new friends and appreciating great music then you must come to one of our concerts. Our performances offer a magical combination of the finest classical-music along with familiar popular selections played by acclaimed and local talented musicians. Our concerts carry a reputation as one of the finest music events in the Treasure Coast. Experience the magic for yourself by listening to the selections available on this page or by viewing some of our live videos.
The success of the Port St. Lucie Community Band not only depends on its musicians, staff and board, but mostly on you, the supportive and loyal audience of the Treasure Coast. Throughout the year, hundreds of music lovers have helped advance the activities and efforts of our organization by attending and promoting our concerts and events.
The Port St. Lucie Community Band is a membership-based organization made up of dedicated musicians who have joined together to share their collective talent and passion for sharing and performing the finest music to gratify and enhance our community.
Delivering Energetic and Passionate Live Performances
Come Join Us At Our Next Concert
See Schedule
Music is the divine way to tell beautiful, poetic things to the heart.
Pablo Casals
.four-columns - sidebar

Meet The Port St. Lucie Community Band
Home
Meet The Port St. Lucie Community Band
mfn_hook_content_before
mfn_hook_content_before
#Content
.sections_group
The Port St. Lucie Community Band is dedicated to providing live musical entertainment
for residents of the vibrant city of Port St. Lucie, Florida and surrounding Treasure Coast communities.
The ensemble was founded in 1989 by several local musicians, with the encouragement of city officials and support from local businesses. The ensemble has grown significantly over the years and performs annually at numerous civic and community events.
The band is recognized as one of the leading performing arts institution in the Treasure Coast. It is described as one of the most vibrant and innovative community band in South Florida. The band seeks to inspire the people and communities of the Treasure Coast and serves as a leader and beacon for the musical arts in Port St. Lucie.
Today, the band is comprised of approximately 70 talented and dedicated musicians from the Treasure Coast in Florida. In addition to full time professional musicians and our local music teachers, members of the band include doctors, attorneys, business professionals, and outstanding local student instrumentalists.
The Port St. Lucie Community band was formed to enrich the arts and music life of the Treasure Coast. We prepare performances intended to inspire, entertain and educate a wide and diverse audience with the unique experience of live symphonic and popular music.
REINVESTING IN OUR COMMUNITY
Building community connections is perhaps the most important component of the band's mission and future. It is our civic duty to not only prepare and present experiences and resources that nurture a deep understanding of music and its connections to our daily lives but also to offer young musicians the opportunity to perfect their craft and further their education.
To this end, as a nonprofit organization, we use a portion of donations to create scholarships for young promising musicians looking to study music in college. Every year we award 1 to 3 scholarship to local deserving students pursuing a music education in college. Each gift goes to support the music you hear, the artistic quality you experience and ultimately enriches the cultural landscape of Port St. Lucie. The most visible impact of giving back is seen in our ability to deliver scholarships to ambitious students looking to grow and innovative their musical skills.
We are investing in our youth through our music programs, family concerts and support in arts education. We have developed a strong community outreach to cultivate an appreciation for the experience of live music and to provide support for music education at all age levels throughout the Treasure Coast. We are and hope to continue to reach a diverse audience with our masterworks concerts.
Music expresses that which cannot be said and on which it is impossible to be silent.
Victor Hugo
HIRE A MUSICIAN
Many of our very proficient musicians, outside of their band responsibilities, interact with the community by playing in small ensembles, performing in schools and at events such as weddings, fundraisers and even funerals. This diversifies the work of our professional musician and allows them to contribute to the community on a different and more personal level.
In addition, many of our musicians are music educators in our local schools and offer private lessons for children and adults. Lessons, for those looking to advance their understanding and musical skills, are a great opportunity to utilize the wonderful resource of having a community of professional musicians.
For information regarding availability and rates please contact us, at
info@pslcommunityband.org.
